text:
Hey guys!
I am new to hubSpot development and I have just started development of a theme using boilerplate. I have all setup in my local system and is working fine. I have no problem syncing local changes to the HubSpot theme. Now, sometime I want to work directly on HubSpot editing platform and I want to sync those changes to my local system. How is this possible?

Thank you in advance!

Hey <@U05S9CZL4PJ> — you are going to want to use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cli#fetch-files|CLI fetch> command to overwrite your original files
<@UQWGKUEN7> Thank you, hope this sync local files with HubSpot editor changes.

Hello everyone! I'm my own HubSpot cms modules, I know how to insert and use different module fields, but I can't find out how to put a image/text field where I can add multiple pairs of these elements to the module, just like the cards in this sprocket rocket module. Could someone give me an advice about how to achieve this feature? Thanks in advance

Hi Alonso — youre looking for <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields-overview#repeater-options|repeater groups>. You can add repeater options to individual fields or to a whole group. Sounds like in your case you will want to add it to a group.

And for future reference — questions like this are likely better suited for <#C2YH119N2|hubl> or <#CFPRTEGTX|modules> — this channel is more for questions specifically for the <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate|cms-boilerplate>. But happy to help regardless.
Thanks so much BJ! it is just what I want to do! Have a nice day!
